SENT.plain: Thromboembolic complications may occur in inflammatory bowel disease
Recently, we had the opportunity to observe a case of a cerebral arterial thrombosis in a young patient with active ulcerative colitis
Investigation of blood coagulation revealed a temporary Protein C, Protein S and Factor II deficiency
To our knowledge, this is the first reported case of a temporary Protein C and S deficiency in a patient with thrombosis and inflammatory bowel disease
